page.title: 02KEMBLE - 2
page.content: {All Saints' Church}still has a 13th century tower and a 16th century spire but the rest of the church was rebuilt in the 1870s in the Early English style. Stone from an old chapel at{ {Ewen}was used to rebuild the South Transept, now known as the{Ewen}aisle. Next to the church is{Kemble House,}a fine{Cotswold}stone manor house and the hub of the{Kemble}estate for many generations. It was built in the 17th century but altered in the 19th century. There are many attractive cottages in Kemble and in{Kemble Wick}and there are also some larger houses dating from Victorian times. The school was built in 1873 and the village hall opposite in 1899.
